DataElement.preferredName: Genomic Medicine Implementation Pharmacogenomics Awareness Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medical discipline that uses genomic information about an individual as part of their clinical care (e.g. for diagnostic or therapeutic decision-making) and for the health outcomes and policy implications of that clinical use. (NIH/NHGRI)._The investigation of variations of DNA and RNA characteristics as related to drug response._Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time._The act of carrying into effect._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

Concepts.definition: A medical discipline that uses genomic information about an individual as part of their clinical care (e.g. for diagnostic or therapeutic decision-making) and for the health outcomes and policy implications of that clinical use. (NIH/NHGRI)

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation of variations of DNA and RNA characteristics as related to drug response.:Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time.

Concepts.definition: The investigation of the collective impact of variations across a genome on drug responses.

Knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing; having special interest in or experience of something and so being well informed of what is happening in that subject at the present time.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: This series of questions can be used to determine an individual's knowledge of pharmacogenomics (PGx) and if the individual is willing to participate in PGx research.
